facts.title: The Traffic Light
facts.fact: Garrett Morgan, a Black inventor, patented the three-position traffic signal in 1923. His design was the precursor to modern traffic lights used worldwide today.

facts.title: Blood Banks
facts.fact: Dr. Charles Drew pioneered methods of storing blood plasma for transfusion and organized the first large-scale blood bank in the US. His research saved countless lives during WWII.

facts.title: First Black Billionaire
facts.fact: Robert L. Johnson became the first Black American billionaire in 2001 after selling BET (Black Entertainment Television) to Viacom for $3 billion.

facts.title: The Harlem Renaissance
facts.fact: The Harlem Renaissance (1920s-1930s) was a cultural explosion that produced some of America's greatest literature, music, and art, including jazz and the works of Langston Hughes and Zora Neale Hurston.

facts.title: The Super Soaker
facts.fact: Lonnie Johnson, a NASA engineer, invented the Super Soaker water gun in 1989. It became one of the top-selling toys in America and has generated over $1 billion in sales.

facts.title: The Green Book
facts.fact: From 1936-1966, 'The Negro Motorist Green Book' helped Black travelers navigate safely through Jim Crow America, listing friendly businesses, hotels, and restaurants.

facts.title: Hidden Figures
facts.fact: Katherine Johnson, Dorothy Vaughan, and Mary Jackson were NASA mathematicians whose calculations were critical to early space missions, including John Glenn's orbital flight.

facts.title: Rock and Roll Origins
facts.fact: Rock and roll was pioneered by Black musicians like Chuck Berry, Little Richard, and Sister Rosetta Tharpe, whose guitar techniques and performance styles defined the genre.

facts.title: First Black Supreme Court Justice
facts.fact: Thurgood Marshall, who argued Brown v. Board of Education, became the first Black Supreme Court Justice in 1967, serving for 24 years.

facts.title: The Home Security System
facts.fact: Marie Van Brittan Brown invented the first home security system in 1966, including closed-circuit television monitoring. Her patent laid groundwork for modern security technology.

facts.title: The Black Wall Street
facts.fact: Greenwood District in Tulsa, Oklahoma was known as 'Black Wall Street' - a thriving, prosperous Black community destroyed in the 1921 Tulsa Race Massacre.

facts.title: Hip Hop Origins
facts.fact: Hip hop was born in the Bronx in 1973 when DJ Kool Herc pioneered the breakbeat technique at a back-to-school party. It grew into a global cultural movement.

facts.title: Open-Heart Surgery Pioneer
facts.fact: Dr. Daniel Hale Williams performed one of the first successful open-heart surgeries in 1893 and founded Provident Hospital, the first Black-owned hospital in America.

facts.title: The Gas Mask
facts.fact: Garrett Morgan also invented the safety hood (an early gas mask) in 1914. He used it to rescue workers trapped in a tunnel explosion under Lake Erie.

facts.title: First Black Astronaut
facts.fact: Guion Bluford became the first Black American in space when he flew aboard the Space Shuttle Challenger in August 1983.

facts.title: Motown Records
facts.fact: Berry Gordy founded Motown Records in 1959 with an $800 loan. It became the most successful Black-owned business in America, launching artists like Stevie Wonder, The Supremes, and Marvin Gaye.

facts.title: The Underground Railroad
facts.fact: Harriet Tubman made 13 missions to rescue approximately 70 enslaved people using the Underground Railroad, earning her the nickname 'Moses.'

facts.title: Peanut Innovations
facts.fact: George Washington Carver developed over 300 products from peanuts, including dyes, plastics, and gasoline. His work revolutionized Southern agriculture.

facts.title: Nobel Peace Prize
facts.fact: Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. became the youngest person to receive the Nobel Peace Prize in 1964 at age 35 for his nonviolent resistance to racial prejudice.

facts.title: Automatic Elevator Doors
facts.fact: Alexander Miles patented an automatic elevator door mechanism in 1887 that made elevators safer and is still used in modern elevator designs.
